text: UPDATED: DEC 26, 2016 Pours a darker golden with good legs. Nose is of cooked apples, peaches and burnt wood. Taste is moderately sweet and pretty acidic with brown sugar flavors and really tart cider. All the acidity cuts into the sweetness quite effectively. A weird bitterness in the finish. Body is medium and mouthfeel syrupy. A little sticky. A nice ice cider that could do without that burnt sugar/wood.
Pours an amber colour. Aroma of caramel apple and red fruit. Tastes sweet, with an almost snickerdoodle cookie like note.
375ml bottle, great ice cider nose. Baked Apple. Flavor is sweet up front but a lot of Apple skin and something else
This has a good balance between acidity and a bit of sweetness. Theres some apple notes, a light spiciness. All told, a decent ice cider.
Draft - Apple peel and light cooked Apple. Clear copper. Nice sweet cooked Apple with peel and almost light tannins. Nice.

375mL bottle, pours a deep dark caramel with a few bubbles. Aroma brings out caramel, treacle tart and brown sugar. Flavour is deep and complex, with loads of treacle tart, caramelized apples, and toffee. Quite sweet and decently acidic. Loads of depth. Fantastic.

375mL bottle from AdamChandler, dont remember exactly but I wanna say it was 2011 or 2012. Drunk on 2/20/16.Raspberry-red with deep caramel-amber tints and good clarity. Light sediment at the bottom of the bottle. Still.Boisterous red fruits, heavy caramel and lovely black pepper all surge forth. Quite forceful but with a little bit of vanilla dryness and some spicy cinnamon.Sweet red macintosh with black pepper and light raspberry again. Vanilla, toffee, caramel and such, but Im not getting the citrus and bitterness suggested in the commercial deScription. Still, it dries out on the end, though in a bit of a dull way (nuttiness, yeast, sediment). Not massively layered in the apple sugar depth like Cachee or some others, but still a very, very nice ice cider. Lightly syrupiness, but not too sweet, nor watery.
From notes. Bottle shared by AdamChandler. Thanks, Adam! Pours golden brown, no head, leaves legs. Strong tart apple aroma. Intense baked apple flavor. Very good.
Poured from bottle thanks AdamChandler reddish brown pour with no head. Aromas of tart apples with brown sugar and dark fruit. Nice.

375 ml bottle thanks, Adam. Brown color without head. Aroma is caramel covers Apple. 
Baked apples, caramel hints, mild sugar. I tense baked apples. Mouthfeel is slick with a fuller body of an Ice Cider. Smooth.

375ML bottle, Pours a reddish dark brown, heavily burnt, very thick, pours a beautiful color. Looks oak aged. Smells like dates, figs, persimmon and cinnamon and brown sugar. Loads of dark fruits. It has this cranberry lemonade rotten apple taste, Dense, intense sweetness. A perfect dessert cider. wow. I wish the mouthfeel was thicker.

pours hazy burnt orange with some nice legs. advanced caramelization, dried and candied fruits - apricots but also berries, chocolate, spicy oranges - reminiscence of terrys chocolate orange*TM; hops (!), zesty citrus. flat carbonation, medium body - oily; very lightly tart and sweet-spicy finish. unique - overly caramelized.

Bottle shared. Copper pour with a fair bit of sediment that got stirred up as we poured, some glasses were cloudy. Aroma of peach, apricot, ripe apples, light spice, alcohol. Taste is sweet, caramel, lots of stone fruit, apricot, pear, mild alcohol warmth on the finish, baked apples. Palate is round pretty full bodied, nice sticky texture. Nice offering.

Bottle @ Mondial des Cidres de Glace 2015. Rating of the 2010 vintage. Slight rose color. Very sugary and maple syrup forward. A bit of apple skins and sweet caramel sauce. This particular cider really lacked any of the normal acidity and is more just sweet and sugary. A lot of caramel, apple pie filling, and brown sugar.

Bottle... This ice cider rocks! Pours amber and clear. Leaves a nice coating around the glass but no legs. Smells like baked, cinnamon-spiced apples. Full-bodied with a velvety mouthfeel. The flavor offers loads of savory sweet apples and wonderful malic acid. Best of both worlds - sweet and sour. Lingering, silky-buttery finish. Many thanks to MartinT for sharing another world class ice cider from French Canada!

2008 vintage bottle sampled at Mondial des Cidres de Glace 2014 with Linh, Minh and Angela. Pours a golden body. Aroma is apple pie, apple sauce, honey, light maple and faint alcohol character. Mouthfeel is medium to full with similar notes coming through on the palate. Nice.
Pours like a big sparkling wine with a nice lacing on the glass. Tart sharpness leaving a acidic balance. apples and sulfur. Great beer

Bottle (375 ml). 2009 Harvest. Thanks Alex! Clear bright golden/orange. Theres a lot of sweetness in the aroma with a bright apple presence, brown sugar and peaches/apricots presence. Taste is also very sweet with caramel, brown sugar, apricots, pears. Nice acidic presence too. Thick body. Liquorous. Very complex. One of the sweetest Ice Cider Ive had so far.

Bottle. Lovely deep orange hue. Aroma is sweet fresh apples and skins, cooked sugars, quince. Sticky sweet apple fruit up front, leading into a sugary simple-syrup middle, but ending with a tart apple skin acidity that carries some nuances tropical fruits. A bit of a mixed bag, but certainly very delicious.
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text: Bottle, pours a nice light clear brown. The apples were nice and smooth, the sweetiness was nice it was the most sweet Ive had, it was definitely one of the beer iced ciders Ive had, good stuff

Corked bottle at Canoe Restaurant, TorontoVintage 2009Beautiful amber color. Deep aroma, somehow different from the other ice ciders; very fruity, with mature apples, some acidity, and a light biscuits note; very light acetic too. Very sweet but possibly less syrupy than expected; excellent flavor of mature apples, moderate acidity; distinctively from others, it doesnt have the same sugary feeling and stewed apples, but it has a very light and pleasant astringency.Excellent.

Bottle shared by a beer friends girlfriend after her trip to Montreal. Pours a beautifully clean and shiny gold, headless. Aroma is rich of apple juice with slight doughy notes. Flavor is sweet of apple juice, sticky of caramel, and slightly tangy of orange/orange peel. Minimally sweet with sticky apple juice finish. Really good!

Pours a clear, slight yellow hint and fairly still.  Aroma is sweet, tarte apple with some honey.  Taste is subtle and subdued although not as pronounced as I would like.  Highly tarte with slight bitterness.

Cuvée 2009: A golden cider with superb cooked apples, light vanilla notes, maple, very nice. In mouth, a smooth apple sauce with light woody notes, very nice alcohol warmth. Tasted at Bières des Neiges et Vins dHiver, Fev. 17 2012.

Bottle that I took to Andys New Years Eve party/tasting/Fluxx tournament.  Pours a clear gold.  Big sugar and sweetness on the nose, dusty apple sugar.  Medium bodied, velvety and smooth, nice bright acid comes through. Apple sugar, lingering acid on the finish.  Yummy.  And fortunately, we had two bottles of this.  Muah ha ha.

(375 ml, 2009)  Belle robe dorée avec de superbes jambes.  Nez fin de pommes et, plus largement, de fruits du verger.  Quant aux papilles, elles sont joyeuses et admiratives devant un bel équilibre entre lacidité des fruits et les sucres décadents.  Sur la langue, le liquide est un véritable velours.  En finale, une belle complexité de fruits gorgés de sucre dérable.

[3956-20110909] 375mL clear bottle. Strong applesauce aroma. Clear, light orange body with no lasting head. Lots of sweet apple and sugary fruit juice flavour. Medium body. Tart and interesting. (7/2+/7/3/13-) 3.2
(w/ jerc, others)

2009-09-09. Crisp golden yellow body. Interesting apple aroma, mostly just fresh apple, some musty skins. 7+ Sweet apple up front turn acidic fairly quickly, sweet fruity character makes appearances but the zippy apple is the star. Smooth medium bodied palate. Different, very interesting. Bottle from SAQ, Montreal

Pour is clear, thick copper.  Nose is kind of light, apple juice, tropical fruits.  Fairly thick mouth, coating, syrupy.  Not nearly as overtly sweet as most apple ice wine.  Tart, acidic qualities are allowed to shine more here.  Of course, a rich apple essence, but with mango, pineapple, and an assortment of acidic, tart tropical fruits.  Acidity and tart flavors interact strangely with the heavily thick body.  Not sure what to make of this one.  Unique, for sure.

2oz blind tasting of 16 different Ice Ciders.
Aroma : Nice acidity with light tropical fruits. Light caramel. Nice notes of pie crust.

Taste : Acidic with nice tropical fruits. More tropical fruits on finish

Overall : Nice acidity with enough sweetness to back it up. Awesome tropical fruits. Taste better than nose. Very nice one. Not a top one but definetely my style of Ice Cider.
Blind tasting scoring sheet : Aroma : 7/10 Balance : 8/10 Complexity : 7/10. General : 15/20. Ranking : 6/16.

Sample, Mondial des cidres de glace, savoured on February 12 2011; eye: golden; nose: frozen apple, cold; mouth: apple, light mineral, light acidity, medium body, liqueur-like, rather sweet; overall: good

FRANÇAIS 

Échantillon, Mondial des cidres de glace, savourée le 12 février 2011 
il : dorée; nez : pomme congelée, froid; bouche : pomme, léger minéral, légère acidité, corps moyen, liquoreux, plutôt sucré; en résumé : bon
Very good stuff. Best ice cider ever! Nice taste and very good aroma. You need to try this!
The finisher of the DC Epic Sour Tasting 2010, courtesy of ygtbsm94, thank you sir!  Bright golden, flat.  Aroma of apple juice.  Taste is a slightly tart apple turnover.  Good stuff!

Courtesy of ygtbsm94. Wow this stuff was awesome. Pours a bright golden with excellent legs. Nose and taste is ultra fresh red apples that begins with rich sweetness and finishes citrusy and tart. Really outstanding.

UPDATED: JUN 6, 2010 Bottle shared by ygtbsm94 on 7/3/09: Pours a clear bright viscous golden with good legs.  Aroma of fresh juicy apples and sweet light caramel with good tartness.  Starts with good fullness and sweet apple fruitiness and fresh tart balance before a crsip, complex finish.  Very well-balanced and enjoyable.

375 ml bottle, bought at the estate, September 21, 2009. Pale straw color. Sour apple aroma, with hints of raisins and mild cheese. Very sour apple taste, very fruity with a touch sweetness, dry finish and very little sensation of alcohol. One of the few ice cider that is more sour then sweet, but I like it!

Bouteille claire, avec bouchon de liège, de 375 ml dégustée avec Goldorak et de amis. Arôme: Odeur de pommes confites avce une pointe dacidité. Apparence: La couleur est dorée. Saveur: Goût de pommes confites avec une pointe dérable. Durée moyenne de larrière goût. Palette: Le corps est moyen avec une texture liquoreuse. Faible effervescence en bouche. Légère présence dérable en arrière goût. (Rating #2374)

UPDATED: MAR 12, 2009 Shared by BrianK.  Pours a chardonnay body with a nice legs around the glass.  Macintosh, sweet tart mouthwatering apple skins.  Caramel apples with a hint of sulfur.  Sweet chewy with some acidity.  Delicious.

Bottle brought to me by Glouglouburp.  Thanks Dany, and you were definately right.  This is the most acidic ice cider ive ever drank.  Pours thin and light colored.  Drinks heavy with great fresh apple flavor and acidity.  I can definately taste Macintosh apple skins in there.  Good stuff and quite refreshing.
